intro: Uapaca nitida var. sokolobe, commonly known as the Sokolobe velvetleaf, is a shrub native to eastern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are often used in local cuisines. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Botanically, it belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important species.
